name: UNA Hotel Vittoria

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Visited Florence for 4 days in December with my girlfriend and the Una Vittoria was lots of fun. Super modern decor, friendly staff, spacious and comfortable room. Only drawback is that its a bit far from the center, especially in the cold of winter so we spent quite a bit on cabs each day. Also there is no wi-fi, just a cable connection which was a bit expensive. Another quip would be that the room service seemed to be pretty poor. On a Sunday we decided to stay in for awhile but the kitchen was closed so we ordered tea and orange juice before heading out. The juice was far from fresh and basically undrinkable and the lipton tea was uninspiring. After this experience we never tried to order anything else from room service. Other than that it was a great bargain and I would definitely stay there again. I would certainly recommend splurging on the executive room. We took a peek at a standard room and they're pretty small. The executive room has twice the space, and an awesome bathroom/shower/tub and you can usually get it at a great rate. You can control all the lights in the room from remote controls on either side of the bed and there is a handy "do not disturb" button that's great for sleeping in late. A great little hotel in a great little town.
reviews.title: Modern Fun In Florence

likes.disliked: — A bit far from the center

reviews.text: I loved this hotel. I had sourced it through tripadvisor.com and tablethotels.com and found a fantastic rate on expedia. The hotel is across the river from most of the sights and tourists spots but it is a very short walk - along the river and a chance to see the real Florence. The hotel itself is very modern (but comfortable), clean and professional. If you like design hotels you will appreciate all of the touches including the beautiful lobby and the doors to each hotel room (framed portraits). The buffet breakfast (included in my rate) is fantastic and was the best I've had in Europe - eggs, sausage, fresh pastries, fruit, juice etc. I was traveling alone (I'm a woman in my thirties) and was not disuaded by the walk into town - I usually ventured back and forth a couple times a day and felt comfortable walking at night. I stayed here on two occasions during my trip - the first for four nights, and the second for two nights - and found my experience consistent. I will absolutely stay here at this hotel when I (hopefully) return to the lovely city of Firenze.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One tip: You MUST, MUST, MUST eat at Aqua All 2 and order the filleto all'aceto balsamico. Delicious.
reviews.title: Great!Great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I`ve been stayed in this hotel with my boyfriend for 4 nights and it was great!
reviews.title: Good experience, but a bit overrated

reviews.text: I loved the location, not in the bustling center, in a very nice, i would say typical Florence area, with good restaurants, nice antique shops etc..
reviews.title: Sybaris of Florence with Bad Food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: only stayed at the vittoria for 2 days ,we found it really great.staff all helpful and pleasant,breakfast everything you could wish for,room overlooking the courtyard.free bus into the twn centre.a lovely peaceful retreat after a hard days sightseeing we would recommend highly
reviews.title: wonderful modern hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have no complaints about this hotel. We throughly enjoyed our 3 nightstay there. On checking in they gave us a third floor room with a roof terrace, as well as a TV room off to the side. The LED lights were not working, but I told reception and they were fixed the next day. Even though the check out was at 12.00 we were not feeling the best and they let us stay in the room until 2. The reception staff were very friendly and the breakfast was a good continental one. We enjoyed eating at the restaurants and the bar down the street, and in a very busy Florence it was good to be off the beaten track. I'm not sure I like the black halls, but this hotel was certainly different. The beds were very comfortable, the water pressure was good in the shower. I would have liked to have stayed there a bit longer. We did not use the pillow menu though!
reviews.title: A very pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The UNA Vittoria is definitely not what you expect to find in Florence, from the moment you walk into the arty foyer it's an unforgettable, ultra modern experience in an old beautiful city. The rooms are very cool with beautiful blue optic lights and every modern convenience. The portraits on the doors were another cool arty touch. The breakfasts were outstanding and the room service dinner as very good. It's a little bit further out of the main part of the city than we would have liked but its a nice walk along the river and they have a free shuttle bus when you're not up for it.
reviews.title: A very unique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was quite a walk from the centre - we're not afraid of lots of walking but in the heat we did find it a bit further than we would have liked, plus there is not an awful lot around the hotel. However on the plus side we ate in some nice local restaurants i.e. full of Italians and no English menu in sight!
reviews.title: Smart Hotel, Small Room, Long Walk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: THe hotel itself is pretty modern, although starting to look like it could be freshened up. The room was really small, it was difficult to find somewhere to put my case and I found the bathroom a bit strange - it felt like an aeroplane / ship bathroom and smelt a bit of damp.
reviews.title: A very cool hotel!

reviews.text: We got a very good deal for this 4 star hotel, much cheaper than some of the other hotels in Florence. Although it's south of the River Arno and the main part of Florence, it's only about a 15 minute work into the centre. The hotel also run a shuttle bus service to Santa Maria Novella train station.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel and experience

likes.liked: — The unique style of the rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were friendly and helpful - they helped up book a walking tour, and also a tour around the Uffizi as all the reserved tickets were booked up for a week. All the staff spoke English.
reviews.title: Exceptional

likes.liked: — A really unique style, a great design that also functions unlike some other boutique hotels.
likes.disliked: — Front desk staff a litte inattentive.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was a good breakfast selection and there was also a bar in the hotel. The hotel is slightly offset from the main road but it is much quieter.
reviews.title: Funky hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The design and style of the hotel and the rooms are completely different to anywhere I've previously stayed but it made it a unique experience.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel and Experience

reviews.text: Having read the reviews of this hotel, we checked in with great expectations.
reviews.title: Good price, fair service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here in June 2007.
reviews.title: Hotel on the edge (of fashion and the city). Hope the a/c works...
Wonderful Stay
reviews.text: Having driven there, I found it quite easy to find (GPS), although you could drive straight past it without knowing there's a hotel there, as the entrance is a driveway between other buildings.

The outside of the hotel strikes a grand impression and is completely incongruent with the interior, which is ultramodern. The floor I stayed on reminded me of what gothic teenagers would probably think of as heaven - black-painted winding passageways. The room was comfortable enough. There's a control by the bed which handles everything from the tv, the fairy lights embedded in the walls and the air-conditioning. Speaking of a/c, ours did not work at all. We asked for it to be looked at but needed to forcibly remind them again when they had not looked at it while we were out. The maintenance guy fiddled around with it for a while to no avail. We were promptly given a new room with functioning a/c (n.b. it won't work if the door to the balcony is ajar). The new room was twice as good as the first. It was much roomier and obviously the a/c worked.
reviews.title: Cool Hotel and Fabulous Breakfast

likes.disliked: — Shower with clear glass and mirrors

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The showers were indeed bizarre. A previous reviewer had a problem with transparent glass. It was translucent , but hey, it's Europe, and without the glass I reckon some people might get claustrophobia in there. This was only present in one out of the two rooms we stayed in.
reviews.title: Funky, Unique and a great experience

reviews.text: I found the staff to be variable. Some were very friendly and respectful, others were languid and almost derogatory.
reviews.title: Better than expected

description: Located in the historical quarter of San Frediano, near the Lungarno, new emotional expression for a hotel planned to amaze guests with its extraordinary modern design realized in the 84 rooms and in the public areas of bar, restaurant and conference rooms, evocative of the ancient Florentine spirit of hospitality. Indoor parking space.
